dict.string: LimPOA is the easiest way to find places where you can dispose your waste in an environmentally-friendly manner in the city of Porto Alegre, delivery points of frying oil, bins and containers. You have a list of the closest places to you, separated by categories. Also you can see informations as telephone, opening hours and address. Do not know the address? Trace a route on map through LimPOA, is very simple! The data of selective waste collection points, bins and containers are powered by the city of Porto Alegre through the project #datapoa.

A simple application that can find details about an address based on a given zipcode (a.k.a CEP in Brazil). The user also can trace a route in the map using througt Cepp. This app works just with brazilians zipcodes and are available only in the brazilian AppStore.
Clip - Find the Better Beauty Service

Clip is a brand new social network that connect customers with beauty centers and professionals. With Clip you can follow your favorite beauty professionals, receive their portfolio updates and share with your friends. Also you can discover what is trending and meet a new professionals! Discover your new favorite beauty center looking at their professionals, services and portfolios. Favorite looks just ‘clipping’ photos you liked, manage your schedules with beauty centers in your profile and be notified about them.
Scrolling down you'll connect the dots that brought me up here.
I left the job that was my dream job in the past. I was looking for new experiences, looking for a job where I could really make the difference.

After quitting my job, I heard about BEPiD(Brazilian Education Program for iOS Development), an educational program to train iOS developers. It was very exciting to me, and despite knowing little about the platform I decided to sign up. I was accepted and early on I realized that would not be the same at the end of this program.

After six months participating in BEPiD I released my first app, which I called LimPOA. The LimPOA is a guide that helps residents of the city of Porto Alegre to properly dispose of their waste and it uses open data provided by the Government.

I was very excited with the announcement of Swift language, so I decided to build an app to explore this new amazing language, I did it and I’ve made it open-source at GitHub to share with the people the way that I used Swift to built my app. I’ve shared it with the intent to help someone to learn and receive suggestions of improvements.
Thanks to the code of my first Swift app that I've opened, I got an "full-Swift" job! It's being amazing work just with Swift and I'm learning a lot about it.

Wow! Thank you for connect this dot and give to me a ticket to WWDC 15! Haha just a joke, but I really want this to became reality. Certainly go to WWDC will bring me a lot of amazing dots that I'll connect in my future.
